column3: 39a}} p.10</ref> is the [[Quenya]] name for the [[Maiar]]in followers of [[Morgoth]] better known in their [[Sindarin]] form: [[Balrogs]].

{{main: In ''[[The Etymologies]]'', the word ''Balrog'' is derived from ''[[ñgwalaraukô]]''<ref name=RUK>{{LR
Balrog}}: Etymologies}}, RUK</ref> displaying a derivation from root ''ñgwal-'' (referring to "torment, cruelty") instead of ''val-''.<ref>{{webcite
column5: articlename=The Truth About Balrogs - What is the etymology of 'balrog'?
column6: website=[http://tolkien.slimy.com/ Tolkien Meta-FAQ]}}</ref> This derivation would produce the Quenya word **Nwalarauco.

{{main: In ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'', the [[Qenya]] term is ''Malcarauce''.
Valarauco is not forming a regular plural  [[Asterisk#Fandom
Balrog}}: **]]''Valaraucor'' but changing the final vowel in the plural (-o > -ar). [[Helge Fauskanger]] suggests that the singular form uses the variant ''rauco'', while the plural form uses the variant ''rauca'' for some reason.<ref name=arda/>

{{main: Another Quenya word which displays similar properties is perhaps ''[[sundo]]''.
